title: South Beach Hotel -- Proud to Host for the City's Annual Bike Week
text:
September 28, 2015 20:16 ET South Beach Hotel -- Proud to Host for the City's Annual Bike Week 
SOUTH BEACH, FL --(Marketwired - September 28, 2015) - A prominent landmark in the Collins Park neighborhood, recently renovated South Beach Hotel is proud to have welcomed biking enthusiasts attending the 3 rd Annual South Beach Bike Week. The fabulous hotel was a sought-after accommodation option during the annual event thanks to its convenient location, only 15 minutes away from Biker Village on 73 rd Street and Collins Avenue inside the North Beach Bandshell. Moreover, the boutique hotel has received praise and top ratings from previous guests who chose it during recent special occasions such as Fashion Week Miami Beach, Miami Spa Month, Miami International Film Festival, and eMerge Americas. 
The 3 rd Annual South Beach Bike Week took place on September 6 th to 8 th and reeled in a record number of attendees, as Biker Village hosted more bike shows, contests, vendors, food, and beverage stands, and other attractions than ever before. A Kick Off Party on Saturday started things off, featuring live music, contests, and stands by a variety of vendors. In the afternoon, the Cartel Baggers Rally Ride arrived at the venue, followed by Fiction Zone Rally Ride. Two contests -- Battle of the Baggers and Chopper Showdown -- captivated spectators, after which awards were presented to the successful winner. While Biker Village closed at 7pm, attendees continued to enjoy music, drinks, and motorcycles at the Espanola Way Biker Block Party before returning to the South Beach Hotel for a good night's sleep and to get ready for the next day's events. 
On Sunday noon, the Uncaged Riderz Rally Ride arrived, just in time for the Cartel Beach Party. Visitors were then given the opportunity to check out the 'Women on Two Wheels' photo expo or watch Ovrhol perform live. Ms. South Beach Bike Week and Best Street Bike contests also took place, followed by an hour-long Best Tattoo competition. Once the excitement was over, biking enthusiasts were welcomed to avail special offers at nearby bars and nightclubs with their Biker Village wristbands. Culture lovers enjoyed touring South Beach's historical Art Deco district and attractions such as the Cultural Campus Collins Park, Jackie Gleason Theater, and the Miami Beach Convention Center. 
South Beach Hotel promises affordable luxury by combining Miami Beach elegance with contemporary style and was proud to offer great deals to attendees of the 3 rd Bike Week. With a range of in-room and on-site amenities, the amazing hotel is complemented by a knowledgeable concierge team and attentive front desk staff, who will guide guests on the best attractions to head to without stretching their budgets.
